page.title: 19CHRCH FRM GEOLOGY & FARMING
page.content: The soil in the area is mainly{Oxford {Clay}.There is also{sandstone}and{ {limestone}.In one area where there is a geological fault{gravel}has been pushed up. The sandstone is very useful to farmers because it dries out relatively quickly after Winter and they can graze cows on it earlier. Grass grows slowly on it in summer because it is free draining. Water travels along the fault and produces springs. There is some{coal}along the fault. The ponds around the farm were very important for watering stock. They are chipped out of compacted soil called{Fuller's Earth}and do not leak.
